RC1_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Ignored on APM1 unless dip-switches are disabled.

RC2_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC2_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC2_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC2_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Ignored on APM1 unless dip-switches are disabled.

RC3_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC3_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC3_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC3_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Ignored on APM1 unless dip-switches are disabled.

RC4_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC4_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC4_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Ignored on APM1 unless dip-switches are disabled.

RC5_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC5_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC5_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Ignored on APM1 unless dip-switches are disabled.

RC5_FUNCTION.Description: Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable this output, any other value will enable the corresponding function

CAM_TRIGG_TYPE.Description: how to trigger the camera to take a picture
CAM_TRIGG_TYPE.Values: 0:Servo,1:Relay,2:Servo and turn off throttle,3:Servo when 3m from waypoint,4:transistor

CAM_DURATION.DisplayName: Duration that shutter is held open
CAM_DURATION.Description: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

CAM_SERVO_ON.Description: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

CAM_SERVO_OFF.Description: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

COMPASS_OFS_X.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the X axis
COMPASS_OFS_X.Description: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Y.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the Y axis
COMPASS_OFS_Y.Description: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Z.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the Z axis
COMPASS_OFS_Z.Description: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_DEC.Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

COMPASS_LEARN.Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets

COMPASS_USE.Description: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

COMPASS_AUTODEC.Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

INS_PRODUCT_ID.Description: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only)

INS_ACCSCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCOFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_GYROFFS_X.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Y.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Z.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_MPU6K_FILTER.Description: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane and APMrover2 is 20Hz. The default value on ArduCopter is 42Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

INAV_ACORR_X.DisplayName: Inertial Nav accelerometer offset correction on x-axis
INAV_ACORR_X.Description: Accelerometer offset correction for the x-axis. Calculated automatically

INAV_ACORR_Y.DisplayName: Inertial Nav accelerometer correction on y-axis
INAV_ACORR_Y.Description: Accelerometer offset correction for the y-axis. Calculated automatically

INAV_ACORR_Z.DisplayName: Inertial Nav accelerometer correction on z-axis
INAV_ACORR_Z.Description: Accelerometer offset correction for the z-axis. Calculated automatically

INAV_TC_XY.Description: Time constant for GPS and accel mixing. Higher TC decreases GPS impact on position estimate

INAV_TC_Z.Description: Time constant for baro and accel mixing. Higher TC decreases barometers impact on altitude estimate

SR0_RAW_SENS.Description: Raw sensor stream rate to ground station

SR0_EXT_STAT.DisplayName: Extended status stream rate to ground station
SR0_EXT_STAT.Description: Extended status stream rate to ground station

SR3_POSITION.Description: Position stream rate to ground station

SR3_EXTRA1.DisplayName: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station
SR3_EXTRA1.Description: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station

SR3_EXTRA2.DisplayName: Extra data type 2 stream rate to ground station
SR3_EXTRA2.Description: Extra data type 2 stream rate to ground station

SR3_EXTRA3.DisplayName: Extra data type 3 stream rate to ground station
SR3_EXTRA3.Description: Extra data type 3 stream rate to ground station

SR3_PARAMS.DisplayName: Parameter stream rate to ground station
SR3_PARAMS.Description: Parameter stream rate to ground station

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

AHRS_BARO_USE.Description: This controls the use of the barometer for vertical acceleration compensation in AHRS. It is currently recommended that you set this value to zero unless you are a developer experimenting with the AHRS system.

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

MNT_MODE.Description: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

MNT_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

MNT_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

MNT_CONTROL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle command from groundstation
MNT_CONTROL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT_CONTROL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle command from groundstation
MNT_CONTROL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT_CONTROL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
MNT_CONTROL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT_STAB_ROLL.Description: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_STAB_TILT.Description: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_STAB_PAN.Description: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_RC_IN_ROLL.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

MNT_ANGMIN_ROL.Description: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMAX_ROL.Description: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

MNT_RC_IN_TILT.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

MNT_ANGMIN_TIL.Description: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMAX_TIL.Description: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

MNT_RC_IN_PAN.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

MNT_ANGMIN_PAN.Description: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMAX_PAN.Description: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

MNT_JSTICK_SPD.Description: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 10 for max speed

MNT2_MODE.Description: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

MNT2_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

MNT2_CONTROL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle command from groundstation
MNT2_CONTROL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT2_CONTROL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle command from groundstation
MNT2_CONTROL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT2_CONTROL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
MNT2_CONTROL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT2_STAB_ROLL.Description: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_STAB_TILT.Description: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_STAB_PAN.Description: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_RC_IN_ROLL.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

MNT2_ANGMIN_ROL.Description: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL.Description: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

MNT2_RC_IN_TILT.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL.Description: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

MNT2_ANGMAX_TIL.Description: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

MNT2_RC_IN_PAN.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

MNT2_ANGMIN_PAN.Description: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

MNT2_ANGMAX_PAN.Description: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

MNT2_JSTICK_SPD.Description: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 10 for max speed

LIM_ENABLED.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the limits system

LIM_REQUIRED.Description: Setting this to 1 will enable the limits pre-arm checklist

LIM_DEBUG.Description: Setting this to 1 will turn on debugging messages on the console and via MAVLink STATUSTEXT messages

LIM_SAFETIME.Description: Automatic return of controls to pilot. Set to 0 to disable (full RTL) or a number of seconds after complete recovery to return the controls to the pilot in STABILIZE

LIM_CHANNEL.Description: Channel for Limits on/off control. If channel exceeds LIMITS_ENABLE_PWM, it turns limits on, and vice-versa.

LIM_RECMODE.Description: Select how Limits should "recover". Set to 0 for RTL-like mode, where the vehicle navigates back to home until it is "safe". Set to 1, for bounce-mode, where the vehicle will hold position when it hits a limit. RTL mode is better for large fenced areas, Bounce mode for smaller spaces. Note: RTL mode will cause the vehicle to yaw 180 degrees (turn around) to navigate towards home when it hits a limit.

LIM_GPSLCK_ON.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the gpslock. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the gpslock

LIM_GPSLCK_REQ.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will make being inside the gpslock a required check before arming the vehicle.

LIM_FNC_ON.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the geofence. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the geofence

LIM_FNC_REQ.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will make being inside the geofence a required check before arming the vehicle.

LIM_FNC_SMPL.Description: "Simple" geofence (enabled - 1) is based on a radius from the home position, "Complex" (disabled - 0) define a complex fence by lat/long positions

LIM_FNC_RAD.Description: Radius of fenced area in meters. A value of 20 creates a 20-meter radius circle (40-meter diameter) from the home point.

LIM_FNC_TOT.Description: Total number of geofence points. This parameter should not be updated manually

LIM_ALT_ON.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the altitude. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the altitude

LIM_ALT_REQ.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will make being inside the altitude a required check before arming the vehicle.

LIM_ALT_MIN.Description: Minimum Altitude. Zero to disable. Sets a "floor" that your vehicle will try to stay above. IF the vehicle is crossing the threshold at speed, it will take a while to recover, so give yourself enough room. Caution: minimum altitude limits can cause unexpected behaviour, such as inability to land, or sudden takeoff. Read the wiki instructions before setting.

LIM_ALT_MAX.Description: Maximum Altitude. Zero to disable. Sets a "ceiling" that your vehicle will try to stay below. IF the vehicle is crossing the threshold at speed, it will take a while to recover.

H_SV1_POS.Description: This is the angular location of swash servo #1.

H_SV2_POS.Description: This is the angular location of swash servo #2.

H_SV3_POS.Description: This is the angular location of swash servo #3.

H_ROL_MAX.Description: This is the maximum allowable roll of the swash plate.

H_PIT_MAX.Description: This is the maximum allowable pitch of the swash plate.

H_COL_MIN.Description: This controls the lowest possible servo position for the swashplate.

H_COL_MAX.Description: This controls the highest possible servo position for the swashplate.

H_COL_MID.Description: This is the swash servo position corresponding to zero collective pitch (or zero lift for Assymetrical blades).

H_GYR_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable an external rudder gyro control which means outputting a gain on channel 7 and using a simpler heading control algorithm. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the external gyro gain on channel 7 and revert to a more complex yaw control algorithm.

H_SWASH_TYPE.Description: Setting this to 0 will configure for a 3-servo CCPM. Setting this to 1 will configure for mechanically mixed "H1".

H_GYR_GAIN.Description: This is the PWM which is passed to the external gyro when external gyro is enabled.

H_SV_MAN.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will pass radio inputs directly to servos. Setting this to Disabled(0) will enable Arducopter control of servos. This is only meant to be used by the Mission Planner using swash plate set-up.

H_PHANG.Description: This corrects for phase angle errors of the helicopter main rotor head. For example if pitching the swash forward also induces a roll, that effect can be offset with this parameter.

H_COLYAW.Description: This is a feed-forward compensation to automatically add rudder input when collective pitch is increased.

H_GOV_SETPOINT.Description: This is the PWM which is passed to the external motor governor when external governor is enabled.

H_RSC_MODE.Description: This sets which ESC control mode is active.

H_RSC_RATE.Description: This sets the time the RSC takes to ramp up to full speed (Soft Start).

H_FLYBAR_MODE.Description: This sets which acro mode is active. (0) is Flybarless (1) is Mechanical Flybar

H_STAB_COL_MIN.Description: This is the minimum collective setpoint in Stabilize Mode

H_STAB_COL_MAX.Description: This is the maximum collective setpoint in Stabilize Mode

MOT_TB_RATIO.Description: Not Used. Will control the speed of the top motors vs bottom motors on frames such as the Octo-Quad and Y6

MOT_TCRV_ENABLE.Description: Controls whether a curve is used to linearize the thrust produced by the motors

MOT_TCRV_MIDPCT.Description: Set the pwm position that produces half the maximum thrust of the motors

MOT_TCRV_MAXPCT.Description: Set to the lowest pwm position that produces the maximum thrust of the motors. Most motors produce maximum thrust below the maximum pwm value that they accept.

SYSID_SW_MREV.Description: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

SYSID_SW_TYPE.Description: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

SERIAL3_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the telemetry port

TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

RTL_ALT.Description: The minimum altitude the model will move to before Returning to Launch. Set to zero to return at current altitude.

SONAR_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the sonar. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the sonar

SONAR_TYPE.Description: Used to adjust scaling to match the sonar used (only Maxbotix sonars are supported at this time)

BATT_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

FS_BATT_ENABLE.Description: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when battery voltage or current runs low

VOLT_DIVIDER.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin voltage * INPUT_VOLTS/1024 * VOLT_DIVIDER)

AMP_PER_VOLT.Description: Used to convert the voltage on the current sensing pin (BATT_CURR_PIN) to the actual current being consumed in amps (curr pin voltage * INPUT_VOLTS/1024 * AMP_PER_VOLT )

INPUT_VOLTS.DisplayName: Max internal voltage of the battery voltage and current sensing pins
INPUT_VOLTS.Description: Used to convert the voltage read in on the voltage and current pins for battery monitoring. Normally 5 meaning 5 volts.

MAG_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

FLOW_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable optical flow. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable optical flow

LOW_VOLT.Description: Set this to the voltage you want to represent low voltage

SUPER_SIMPLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable Super Simple Mode. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable Super Simple Mode

RTL_ALT_FINAL.Description: This is the altitude the vehicle will move to as the final stage of Returning to Launch or after completing a mission. Set to -1 to disable, zero to land.

TILT.Description: This is a feed-forward compensation which helps the aircraft achieve target waypoint speed.

BATT_VOLT_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

BATT_CURR_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

RSSI_PIN.Description: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

THR_ACC_ENABLE.Description: This allows enabling and disabling the accelerometer based throttle controller. If disabled a velocity based controller is used.

YAW_OVR_BEHAVE.Description: Controls when autopilot takes back normal control of yaw after pilot overrides

WP_TOTAL.Description: Total number of commands in the mission stored in the eeprom. Do not update this parameter directly!

WP_INDEX.Description: The index number of the command that is currently being executed. Do not update this parameter directly!

WP_RADIUS.Description: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

CIRCLE_RADIUS.Description: Defines the radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

WP_SPEED_MAX.Description: Defines the speed which the aircraft will attempt to maintain during a WP mission.

XTRK_GAIN_SC.Description: This controls the rate that the Auto Controller will attempt to return original track

XTRK_MIN_DIST.Description: Minimum distance in meters between waypoints to do crosstrack correction.

RTL_LOIT_TIME.Description: Time (in milliseconds) to loiter above home before begining final descent

LAND_SPEED.Description: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

AUTO_VELZ_MIN.DisplayName: Autopilot's min vertical speed (max descent) in cm/s
AUTO_VELZ_MIN.Description: The minimum vertical velocity (i.e. descent speed) the autopilot may request in cm/s

AUTO_VELZ_MAX.DisplayName: Auto pilot's max vertical speed in cm/s
AUTO_VELZ_MAX.Description: The maximum vertical velocity the autopilot may request in cm/s

PILOT_VELZ_MAX.Description: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

THR_MIN.Description: The minimum throttle that will be sent to the motors to keep them spinning

THR_MAX.Description: The maximum throttle that will be sent to the motors

FS_THR_ENABLE.Description: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel
FS_THR_ENABLE.Values: 0:Disabled,1:Enabled always RTL,2:Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

FS_THR_VALUE.Description: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers

TRIM_THROTTLE.Description: The autopilot's estimate of the throttle required to maintain a level hover. Calculated automatically from the pilot's throttle input while in stabilize mode

FLTMODE1.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is <= 1230

FLTMODE2.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1230, <= 1360

FLTMODE3.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1360, <= 1490

FLTMODE4.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1490, <= 1620

FLTMODE5.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1620, <= 1749

FLTMODE6.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >=1750

SIMPLE.Description: Bitmask which holds which flight modes use simple heading mode (eg bit 0 = 1 means Flight Mode 0 uses simple mode)

LOG_BITMASK.Description: 2 byte bitmap of log types to enable

TOY_RATE.Description: Controls yaw rate in Toy mode. Higher values will cause a slower yaw rate. Do not set to zero!

ESC.Description: Controls whether ArduCopter will enter ESC calibration on the next restart. Do not adjust this parameter manually.

TUNE.Description: Controls which parameters (normally PID gains) are being tuned with transmitter's channel 6 knob

TUNE_LOW.Description: The minimum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

TUNE_HIGH.Description: The maximum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

CH7_OPT.Description: Select which function if performed when CH7 is above 1800 pwm

AUTO_SLEW.Description: This restricts the rate of change of the roll and pitch attitude commanded by the auto pilot

RC_SPEED.Description: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

ACRO_P.Description: Used to convert pilot roll, pitch and yaw input into a dssired rate of rotation in ACRO mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

AXIS_ENABLE.Description: Used to control whether acro mode actively maintains the current angle when control sticks are released (Enabled = maintains current angle)

ACRO_BAL_ROLL.Description: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode

ACRO_BAL_PITCH.Description: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode

ACRO_TRAINER.Description: Set to 1 (Enabled) to make roll return to within 45 degrees of level automatically

LED_MODE.Description: bitmap to control the copter led mode

RATE_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
RATE_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

RATE_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
RATE_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

RATE_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
RATE_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

RATE_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
RATE_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

RATE_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain
RATE_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

RATE_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain
RATE_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

RATE_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum
RATE_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

RATE_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
RATE_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

RATE_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain
RATE_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

RATE_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain
RATE_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

RATE_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum
RATE_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

RATE_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain
RATE_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

LOITER_LAT_P.DisplayName: Loiter latitude rate controller P gain
LOITER_LAT_P.Description: Loiter latitude rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired speed and actual speed into a lean angle in the latitude direction

LOITER_LAT_I.DisplayName: Loiter latitude rate controller I gain
LOITER_LAT_I.Description: Loiter latitude rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired speed and actual speed in the latitude direction

LOITER_LAT_IMAX.DisplayName: Loiter rate controller I gain maximum
LOITER_LAT_IMAX.Description: Loiter rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the lean angle that the I gain will output

LOITER_LAT_D.DisplayName: Loiter latitude rate controller D gain
LOITER_LAT_D.Description: Loiter latitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

LOITER_LON_P.DisplayName: Loiter longitude rate controller P gain
LOITER_LON_P.Description: Loiter longitude rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired speed and actual speed into a lean angle in the longitude direction

LOITER_LON_I.DisplayName: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain
LOITER_LON_I.Description: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired speed and actual speed in the longitude direction

LOITER_LON_IMAX.DisplayName: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain maximum
LOITER_LON_IMAX.Description: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the lean angle that the I gain will output

LOITER_LON_D.Description: Loiter longitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

NAV_LAT_P.DisplayName: Navigation latitude rate controller P gain
NAV_LAT_P.Description: Navigation latitude rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired speed and actual speed into a lean angle in the latitude direction

NAV_LAT_I.DisplayName: Navigation latitude rate controller I gain
NAV_LAT_I.Description: Navigation latitude rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired speed and actual speed in the latitude direction

NAV_LAT_IMAX.DisplayName: Navigation rate controller I gain maximum
NAV_LAT_IMAX.Description: Navigation rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the lean angle that the I gain will output

NAV_LAT_D.DisplayName: Navigation latitude rate controller D gain
NAV_LAT_D.Description: Navigation latitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

NAV_LON_P.DisplayName: Navigation longitude rate controller P gain
NAV_LON_P.Description: Navigation longitude rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired speed and actual speed into a lean angle in the longitude direction

NAV_LON_I.DisplayName: Navigation longitude rate controller I gain
NAV_LON_I.Description: Navigation longitude rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired speed and actual speed in the longitude direction

NAV_LON_IMAX.DisplayName: Navigation longitude rate controller I gain maximum
NAV_LON_IMAX.Description: Navigation longitude rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the lean angle that the I gain will generate

NAV_LON_D.Description: Navigation longitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

THR_RATE_P.Description: Throttle rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

THR_RATE_I.Description: Throttle rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical speed and actual speed

THR_RATE_IMAX.DisplayName: Throttle rate controller I gain maximum
THR_RATE_IMAX.Description: Throttle rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the desired acceleration that the I gain will generate

THR_RATE_D.Description: Throttle rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical speed vs actual speed

THR_ACCEL_P.Description: Throttle acceleration controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

THR_ACCEL_I.Description: Throttle acceleration controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

THR_ACCEL_IMAX.DisplayName: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum
THR_ACCEL_IMAX.Description: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

THR_ACCEL_D.Description: Throttle acceleration controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

OF_RLL_P.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis P gain
OF_RLL_P.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis P gain. Converts the position error from the target point to a roll angle

OF_RLL_I.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain
OF_RLL_I.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain. Corrects long-term position error by more persistently rolling left or right

OF_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain maximum
OF_RLL_IMAX.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum roll angle that the I term will generate

OF_RLL_D.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis D gain
OF_RLL_D.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis D gain. Compensates for short-term change in speed in the roll direction

OF_PIT_P.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis P gain
OF_PIT_P.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis P gain. Converts the position error from the target point to a pitch angle

OF_PIT_I.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain
OF_PIT_I.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain. Corrects long-term position error by more persistently pitching left or right

OF_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain maximum
OF_PIT_IMAX.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pitch angle that the I term will generate

OF_PIT_D.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis D gain
OF_PIT_D.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis D gain. Compensates for short-term change in speed in the pitch direction

STB_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis stabilize controller P gain
STB_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

STB_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis stabilize controller I gain
STB_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired roll angle and actual angle

STB_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
STB_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum roll rate that the I term will generate

STB_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis stabilize controller P gain
STB_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

STB_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis stabilize controller I gain
STB_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired pitch angle and actual angle

STB_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
STB_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pitch rate that the I term will generate

STB_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis stabilize controller P gain
STB_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

STB_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis stabilize controller I gain
STB_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired yaw angle and actual angle

STB_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
STB_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum yaw rate that the I term will generate

THR_ALT_P.Description: Altitude controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

THR_ALT_I.Description: Altitude controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired altitude and actual altitude

THR_ALT_IMAX.Description: Altitude controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum climb rate rate that the I term will generate

HLD_LAT_P.DisplayName: Loiter latitude position controller P gain
HLD_LAT_P.Description: Loiter latitude position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

HLD_LAT_I.DisplayName: Loiter latitude position controller I gain
HLD_LAT_I.Description: Loiter latitude position controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term distance (in latitude) to the target location

HLD_LAT_IMAX.DisplayName: Loiter latitude position controller I gain maximum
HLD_LAT_IMAX.Description: Loiter latitude position controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum desired speed that the I term will generate

HLD_LON_P.DisplayName: Loiter longitude position controller P gain
HLD_LON_P.Description: Loiter longitude position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the longitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter longitude rate controller

HLD_LON_I.DisplayName: Loiter longitude position controller I gain
HLD_LON_I.Description: Loiter longitude position controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term distance (in longitude direction) to the target location

HLD_LON_IMAX.DisplayName: Loiter longitudeposition controller I gain maximum
HLD_LON_IMAX.Description: Loiter longitudeposition controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum desired speed that the I term will generate

CAM_TRIGG_TYPE.Description: how to trigger the camera to take a picture
CAM_TRIGG_TYPE.Values: 0:Servo,1:Relay,2:Servo and turn off throttle,3:Servo when 3m from waypoint,4:transistor

CAM_DURATION.DisplayName: Duration that shutter is held open
CAM_DURATION.Description: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

CAM_SERVO_ON.Description: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

CAM_SERVO_OFF.Description: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

RC1_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Ignored on APM1 unless dip-switches are disabled.

COMPASS_OFS_X.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the X axis
COMPASS_OFS_X.Description: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Y.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the Y axis
COMPASS_OFS_Y.Description: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Z.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the Z axis
COMPASS_OFS_Z.Description: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_DEC.Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

COMPASS_LEARN.Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets

COMPASS_USE.Description: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

COMPASS_AUTODEC.Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

INS_PRODUCT_ID.Description: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only)

INS_ACCSCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCOFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_GYROFFS_X.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Y.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Z.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_MPU6K_FILTER.Description: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane and APMrover2 is 20Hz. The default value on ArduCopter is 42Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

AHRS_BARO_USE.Description: This controls the use of the barometer for vertical acceleration compensation in AHRS. It is currently recommended that you set this value to zero unless you are a developer experimenting with the AHRS system.

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

MNT_MODE.Description: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

MNT_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

MNT_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

MNT_CONTROL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle command from groundstation
MNT_CONTROL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT_CONTROL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle command from groundstation
MNT_CONTROL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT_CONTROL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
MNT_CONTROL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT_STAB_ROLL.Description: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_STAB_TILT.Description: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_STAB_PAN.Description: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_RC_IN_ROLL.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

MNT_ANGMIN_ROL.Description: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMAX_ROL.Description: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

MNT_RC_IN_TILT.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

MNT_ANGMIN_TIL.Description: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMAX_TIL.Description: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

MNT_RC_IN_PAN.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

MNT_ANGMIN_PAN.Description: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMAX_PAN.Description: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

MNT_JSTICK_SPD.Description: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 10 for max speed

MNT2_MODE.Description: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

MNT2_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

MNT2_CONTROL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle command from groundstation
MNT2_CONTROL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT2_CONTROL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle command from groundstation
MNT2_CONTROL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT2_CONTROL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
MNT2_CONTROL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT2_STAB_ROLL.Description: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_STAB_TILT.Description: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_STAB_PAN.Description: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_RC_IN_ROLL.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

MNT2_ANGMIN_ROL.Description: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL.Description: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

MNT2_RC_IN_TILT.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL.Description: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

MNT2_ANGMAX_TIL.Description: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

MNT2_RC_IN_PAN.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

MNT2_ANGMIN_PAN.Description: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

MNT2_ANGMAX_PAN.Description: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

MNT2_JSTICK_SPD.Description: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 10 for max speed

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the main uart

SERIAL3_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the telemetry port

TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

KFF_PTCHCOMP.Description: Adds pitch input to compensate for the loss of lift due to roll control. 0 = 0 %, 1 = 100%

KFF_RDDRMIX.Description: The amount of rudder mix to apply during aileron movement 0 = 0 %, 1 = 100%

MANUAL_LEVEL.Description: Setting this to Disabled(0) will enable autolevel on every boot. Setting it to Enabled(1) will do a calibration only when you tell it to

STICK_MIXING.Description: When enabled, this adds user stick input to the control surfaces in auto modes, allowing the user to have some degree of flight control without changing modes

RUDDER_STEER.DisplayName: Rudder steering on takeoff and landing
RUDDER_STEER.Description: When enabled, only rudder will be used for steering during takeoff and landing, with the ailerons used to hold the plane level

land_pitch_cd.Description: Used in autoland for planes without airspeed sensors in hundredths of a degree

land_flare_alt.Description: Altitude in autoland at which to lock heading and flare to the LAND_PITCH_CD pitch

land_flare_sec.Description: Time before landing point at which to lock heading and flare to the LAND_PITCH_CD pitch

XTRK_GAIN_SC.Description: The scale between distance off the line and angle to meet the line (in Degrees * 100)

XTRK_ANGLE_CD.Description: Maximum angle used to correct for track following.

XTRK_USE_WIND.Description: If enabled, use wind estimation for navigation crosstrack when using a compass for yaw

XTRK_MIN_DIST.Description: Minimum distance in meters between waypoints to do crosstrack correction.

ALT_MIX.Description: The percent of mixing between gps altitude and baro altitude. 0 = 100% gps, 1 = 100% baro

ALT_CTRL_ALG.Description: This sets what algorithm will be used for altitude control. The default is to select the algorithm based on whether airspeed is enabled. If you set it to 1, then the airspeed based algorithm won't be used for altitude control, but airspeed can be used for other flight control functions

ALT_OFFSET.Description: This is added to the target altitude in automatic flight. It can be used to add a global altitude offset to a mission, or to adjust for barometric pressure changes

WP_RADIUS.Description: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

WP_LOITER_RAD.Description: Defines the distance from the waypoint center, the plane will maintain during a loiter

FENCE_ACTION.Description: What to do on fence breach

FENCE_TOTAL.Description: Number of geofence points currently loaded

FENCE_CHANNEL.Description: RC Channel to use to enable geofence. PWM input above 1750 enables the geofence

FENCE_MINALT.Description: Minimum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

FENCE_MAXALT.Description: Maximum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

ARSPD_FBW_MIN.Description: Airspeed corresponding to minimum throttle in Fly By Wire B mode.

ARSPD_FBW_MAX.Description: Airspeed corresponding to maximum throttle in Fly By Wire B mode.

FBWB_ELEV_REV.Description: Reverse sense of elevator in FBWB. When set to 0 up elevator (pulling back on the stick) means to lower altitude. When set to 1, up elevator means to raise altitude.

THR_MIN.Description: The minimum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply.

THR_MAX.Description: The maximum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply.

THR_SLEWRATE.Description: maximum percentage change in throttle per second. A setting of 10 means to not change the throttle by more than 10% of the full throttle range in one second

THR_SUPP_MAN.Description: When throttle is supressed in auto mode it is normally forced to zero. If you enable this option, then while suppressed it will be manual throttle. This is useful on petrol engines to hold the idle throttle manually while waiting for takeoff

THR_PASS_STAB.Description: If this is set then when in STABILIZE or FBWA mode the throttle is a direct passthru from the transmitter. This means the THR_MIN and THR_MAX settings are not used in these modes. This is useful for petrol engines where you setup a throttle cut switch that suppresses the throttle below the normal minimum.

THR_FAILSAFE.Description: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

THR_FS_VALUE.Description: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers

TRIM_THROTTLE.Description: The target percentage of throttle to apply for normal flight

THROTTLE_NUDGE.Description: When enabled, this uses the throttle input in auto-throttle modes to 'nudge' the throttle to higher or lower values

FS_SHORT_ACTN.Description: The action to take on a short (1 second) failsafe event

FS_LONG_ACTN.Description: The action to take on a long (20 second) failsafe event

FS_GCS_ENABL.Description: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. Failsafe will trigger after 20 seconds of no MAVLink heartbeat messages. WARNING: Enabling this option opens up the possibility of your plane going into failsafe mode and running the motor on the ground it it loses contact with your ground station. If this option is enabled on an electric plane then either use a separate motor arming switch or remove the propeller in any ground testing.

FLTMODE_CH.Description: RC Channel to use for flight mode control

FLTMODE1.Description: Flight mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

FLTMODE2.Description: Flight mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

FLTMODE3.Description: Flight mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

FLTMODE4.Description: Flight mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

FLTMODE5.Description: Flight mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

FLTMODE6.Description: Flight mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

LIM_ROLL_CD.Description: The maximum commanded bank angle in either direction

LIM_PITCH_MAX.Description: The maximum commanded pitch up angle

LIM_PITCH_MIN.Description: The minimum commanded pitch down angle

AUTO_TRIM.Description: Set RC trim PWM levels to current levels when switching away from manual mode

LOG_BITMASK.Description: bitmap of log fields to enable

RST_SWITCH_CH.Description: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

RST_MISSION_CH.Description: RC channel to use to reset the mission to the first waypoint. When this channel goes above 1750 the mission is reset. Set RST_MISSION_CH to 0 to disable.

TRIM_ARSPD_CM.Description: Airspeed in cm/s to aim for when airspeed is enabled in auto mode

SCALING_SPEED.DisplayName: speed used for speed scaling calculations
SCALING_SPEED.Description: Airspeed in m/s to use when calculating surface speed scaling. Note that changing this value will affect all PID values

MIN_GNDSPD_CM.Description: Minimum ground speed in cm/s when under airspeed control

TRIM_PITCH_CD.Description: offset to add to pitch - used for trimming tail draggers

MAG_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

APM_PER_VOLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to

AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT_VOLT_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

BATT_CURR_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

RSSI_PIN.Description: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

INS_PRODUCT_ID.Description: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only)

INS_ACCSCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCOFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_GYROFFS_X.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Y.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Z.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_MPU6K_FILTER.Description: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane and APMrover2 is 20Hz. The default value on ArduCopter is 42Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

AHRS_BARO_USE.Description: This controls the use of the barometer for vertical acceleration compensation in AHRS. It is currently recommended that you set this value to zero unless you are a developer experimenting with the AHRS system.

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

SERIAL3_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the telemetry port

TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

MANUAL_LEVEL.Description: Setting this to Disabled(0) will enable autolevel on every boot. Setting it to Enabled(1) will do a calibration only when you tell it to

XTRK_GAIN_SC.Description: The scale between distance off the line and angle to meet the line (in Degrees * 100)

XTRK_ANGLE_CD.Description: Maximum angle used to correct for track following.

THR_MIN.Description: The minimum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply.

THR_MAX.Description: The maximum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply.

THR_SLEWRATE.Description: maximum percentage change in throttle per second. A setting of 10 means to not change the throttle by more than 10% of the full throttle range in one second

THR_FAILSAFE.Description: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

THR_FS_VALUE.Description: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers

TRIM_THROTTLE.Description: The target percentage of throttle to apply for normal flight

FS_SHORT_ACTN.Description: The action to take on a short (1 second) failsafe event

FS_LONG_ACTN.Description: The action to take on a long (20 second) failsafe event

FS_GCS_ENABL.Description: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. Failsafe will trigger after 20 seconds of no MAVLink heartbeat messages

FLTMODE_CH.Description: RC Channel to use for flight mode control

FLTMODE1.Description: Flight mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

FLTMODE2.Description: Flight mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

FLTMODE3.Description: Flight mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

FLTMODE4.Description: Flight mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

FLTMODE5.Description: Flight mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

FLTMODE6.Description: Flight mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

BATT_VOLT_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

BATT_CURR_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

RSSI_PIN.Description: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

SONAR_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the sonar. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the sonar
